intro: Roupala yauaperyensis, commonly known as the Yauapey palm, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by oval-shaped fruits containing edible seeds. Roupala yauaperyensis plays a vital role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
